website_summaries.verdict: A simple and affordable solution for those searching for a turntable preamplifier, although the lack of controls may turn off some.
pros: Converts phono signals into line level signals
Simple design with RCA inputs and outputs
Has a grounding post for attaching a turntable grounding wire
cons: No controls, so you have no way to adjust the output

customer_reviews.title: Good, no BS preamp
customer_reviews.text: Build quality and value is second to none. Sound quality is as expected. This preamp only amplified the sound from a record play, it does not sound processing. I hear people whine that the sound from this isn’t as good as more expensive preamps but like I said it doesn’t change the sound. Connect this to a good receiver or sound system and the sound is great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonoholic

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, but effective
customer_reviews.text: Naturally, if you’re thinking of buying this preamp it’s because you’re on a limited budget. It essentially does what it’s supposed to do which is simply to preamp your turntable so you can connect directly to powered speakers. With that said, it really depends if you’ll be giving it heavy use or even to high output. I’m simply using this to connect a Technics turntable to powered bookshelf speakers. For my needs, it works fine. It could have more kick to it but then again it’s quite inexpensive so know that before purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Britrock

customer_reviews.title: Works great, just make sure you have a ground wire!
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with this little amp. It just gets the job done, without anything complicated and without taking up much room at all. Super easy to hook up, and works great. Make sure you have a ground wire to connect between your turntable and the amp, or else you're bound to get some buzzing! It's almost half the price it was when I bought it, so if you're just reading it now and are on the fence, go for it! You have nothing to lose!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Unbeatable Price-to-Performance
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit as a temporary placeholder when I lent a spare turntable to a friend whose Bose unit lacked a phono input. This little unit is definitely a keeper. It's surprisingly musical, with an acceptably low noise floor. Objectively speaking, it's probably a three-and-a-half-star component but it wins extra marks for its unbeatable price to performance. The bottom line is that if you hook this up to good components you’ll get decent sound but it won’t perform miracles with a mediocre system.
customer_reviews.author: J Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Bought a new Denon Home Entertainment Receiver last week, then during installation I realized it would not support my classic old 1984 Pioneer PL-88F Turntable, which I love dearly and have completely refurbished over the years. I was not giving in on this. Bought this Pyle "adapter" if you will, plugged it in between the old turntable and the new Receiver, and the turntable was immediately recognized by the brain in the new Devon Receiver! I was amazed. It works perfectly. We'll see how long it lasts, but for now we are VERY happy.
customer_reviews.author: John L. Alvey

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done with some flaws
customer_reviews.text: I'm no particular audiophile, so the audio quality on this versus another higher priced system isn't that important to me. It does the job I need it to since I don't have a stereo with a proper Phono input. My issue with it is the craftsmanship/quality or lack thereof. It's a thin sheet steel case and mine arrived with stripped threads for the ground thumb screw, so much so that it can't be used. I needed to grab a screwdriver and make use of one of the other chassis screws to ground my turntable instead.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Nice preamp for my computer speakers
customer_reviews.text: The audio output of my computer is too low. Even though my speakers had a built-in amp, I still could not get sufficient sound volume. I used wiring adapters to switch from the computer's 5mm output to the preamp's RCA input, then the preamp's RCA output back to 5mm, then connected to my speakers. Now I can hear the sound from my computer! The preamp has been plugged-in for two weeks now and is operating normally. This was a much more cost effective solution than replacing the sound card...or replacing the computer!
customer_reviews.author: MichaelP

customer_reviews.title: Product Registration Scam
customer_reviews.text: Pyle tells you to register your product in order to receive your one year warranty. The only thing is their registration page and submit button are not functional... open the source code window... there's no registration connection. I tried to submit a concern via their "Contact Us" form except that tells you that it can't complete any submissions. No registration, no warranty, no customer service on your purchase... get the picture.? STAY AWAY FROM PYLE!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Luv2read

customer_reviews.title: WTF, Gone in 10 minutes...
customer_reviews.text: I rolled the dice on this one. I'm siding with the nay sayers. Out of the box, DC input connection is loose. I had to wiggle it to find the sweet spot of power connection. Then it worked for a while and sounded fine. A few minutes later, I decided to unplug and plugged again to a different power outlet. Now this thing doesn't work anymore. An hour later, still nothing. This goes to the trash now...
customer_reviews.author: rvlxn

customer_reviews.title: Horrible line noise, non-existent customer support.  Literally. Amazon offers zero support
customer_reviews.text: Ambient noise is terrible...huge line noise makes for terrible play. And Amazon offers ZERO support for Pyle products, gives you a link to click that is non-operative, there is no one to contact, so in short...tough sh$@t. I would have enjoyed burning a $20 bill MUCH more.... Horrible
customer_reviews.author: SBGuy

customer_reviews.title: Bad Power Supply
customer_reviews.text: Received this order on time and in good condition. Upon plugging it in the power light would come on then immediately go off. After verifying that the outlet was good and trying many others I determined that it might me the power supply. I took a similar power supply from another device (12volt 2.0am). Plugged it and it it worked like a champ. So I wound conclude the many people that had problems were more then likely related to the power supply. HOW DO I GO ABOUT GETTTING ANOTHER POWER SUPPLY? Thank You, Bruce M.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce M

customer_reviews.title: Easy Fix to Add your Turntable back inot your Entertainment Center
customer_reviews.text: Redesigning my entertainment center I still wanted my turntable to play my vinyl but didn't want all the amps, tuners, etc. I put this preamp between my turntable and my sound bar that has SmartCast and made a perfect pairing. I can still enjoy all my old vinyl and not have all the electronic paraphernalia that was needed with it. The sound is great! There's no hissing even with I pump it up. This is a simple and inexpensive not to mention great sounding way to add your turntable back into your upgraded entertainment setup. Arekay
customer_reviews.author: Rich K

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution to a common problem
customer_reviews.text: I love my old vinyl collection, but most modern pro audio mixing boards etc. are missing the RIAA-equalized low voltage phono input. This little guy is economical, but does exactly what it needs to do -- adapt my 1970's moving magnet cartridge phono to my Presonus StudioLive board. Great audio quality, easy to setup. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Steve E. Curd

customer_reviews.title: Didn't improve my set up at all.
customer_reviews.text: Well folks, maybe it's just my set up?? But I tried 2 different turntables, and noticed absolutely no gain in volume or sound quality.. it's ok?? My system wasn't that bad to begin with? I just thought this would "boost" the volume of my vinyl. No worries though, I did the return thing-y from Amazon, and will drop it off at UPS Monday.. I'd not go to the trouble, since it was less than $20? But I totally won't use it. Cheers people.
customer_reviews.author: Jay McKenney

customer_reviews.title: Died after 6 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly fine for 6 weeks- with light use. Today I went behind the receiver to plug in an unrelated unit, slightly nudged this little box and it apparently doesn't like to be touched because now it's useless. I checked it on two systems with different cords. It lights up but does nothing except pass through very fuzzy noise.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.D.

customer_reviews.title: Worked for TV blue tooth adapter.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a preamp for my TV so I could use for my blue tooth adapter. I have a blue tooth head set and wanted to listen privately to my TV in my travel trailer. The TV didn't have a head set output so I used the preamp on the RCA out put to connect to the adapter. The only bad feature is the TV sound had to be turned down below normal room listening level so it wouldn't over power the preamp.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Mako

customer_reviews.title: Pyle pre amp for turntable hook up to new digital Tuners
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this from Amazon when another retailer shipped me the incorrect item. I mention this because Amazon had the Pyle amp on same day shipment to me for a small fee. Amazon delivered the same day!!! yeah Amazon. This pre amp was all I needed to install my turntable to my new 7.2. This inexpensive pre amp is incredible, I can now listen to albums I purchased over the last 50+ years. The quality is incredible!! a great finish to my amplifier install!!!
customer_reviews.author: P. Cox photography

customer_reviews.title: Easy and adaptable
customer_reviews.text: With a new Sony Multi Channel Receiver (STR-DH790) replacing my nearly 40 year-old stereo receiver, my nearly 40 year-old Technics SL-B200 turntable needed an inline pre-amplifier. This little Pyle Preamp easily and quickly did the trick. Plug and play with stereo RCA jacks (or the optional stereo quarter inch female port) this could not have been easier; unless a company rep flew out, snuck into my house, and installed while I napped. This little gem is reasonably priced and small enough to hide behind the larger equipment; although hiding is unnecessary. A small green light on top glows to alert you the device is active. No moving (or breakable) parts as you control the volume from your receiving device.
customer_reviews.author: F. R. Gallo Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Solidly made, Great sounds for the price!
customer_reviews.text: As others have mentioned, for the price, this preamp is amazing. I needed something that would let me pass an old record player through my normal, modern receiver (so I'm obviously not a hardcore audiophile), and this did the trick. Setup was simple (put the color pointy bits into the same color roundy bits, plug the other bit into the wall), and the results were that I can now purchase (and listen to) records and pretend I'm cool and hip!
customer_reviews.author: TNH

customer_reviews.title: This could have been a great product.
customer_reviews.text: What I like is that it is inexpensive. Why I don't like is there is no manual for this item. None to download. I have specific questions on set up that I would get from a manual. The only way is to contact there technical support. I don't have the time to sit and wait on the phone for some jackass to placate me. The product works as designed. I had to play with it for over 4 hours to get the desired results. Would I purchase again? In a word NO.
customer_reviews.author: Scott R

customer_reviews.title: Overmodulated
customer_reviews.text: Connected my Pyle to many different sources. If i connected it to a powered amp, it had way too much gain and was heavily distorted. An unpowered source was too quiet. Tried a new turntable with a leveled output and an older Philips unit that needed to be grounded. The powered unit was heavily clipped and distorted, the older one that needed to be grounded had a hum. I grounded my older turntable elsewhere and still way worse than connecting directly into my receiver. Not a happy customer - maybe I received a defective unit? I'd return it, but cannot find a return address in my shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Krohn

customer_reviews.title: Pyle sucks
customer_reviews.text: Thought I would try it for a temporary fix until stereo system is set up. And again, Pyle convinced me how their products are junk. You get what you pay for. Not only was the sound and volume quality not there, but the ground screw for the phonograph to hook up to was cross threaded from the factory and wouldn't tighten. No matter what you read in the reviews, DON'T BUY A PYLE PRODUCT! If people say it's good, they are delusional.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A pyle of crap
customer_reviews.text: I should have paid attention to the other reviews...especially the negative ones. This is the lowest quality phono preamplifier that I've ever witnessed. First of all the output is not adjustable and way too loud. Second there's a hum and buzz that cannot be removed no matter what turntable or amp I've tried. I'm sending it back ...good riddance. Don't waste your money on this junk.
customer_reviews.author: Samplerman

customer_reviews.title: Great Preamp
customer_reviews.text: This phono preamp was a replacement to a turntable that was in storage. Works exceptionally well and at an incredible price!! You need this as a replacement or backup phono cartridge amp! Thank you to the seller for making this preamp available!!
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: The importance of commond ground
customer_reviews.text: The amp works fine good quality sound. Anytime you connect two devices with separate AC plugs to the same AC source you are liable to get a objectionable AC 60 Hertz Buzz unless you ground both devices to a commond grounding point. That is usually the third round hole in a AC wall outlet. Or tie the PP 444 ground terminal to the chassis of your phono player. sometimes you can reduce the hum by reversing one of the two AC Wall plugs but not always.
customer_reviews.author: roger

customer_reviews.title: Not for the Audiophile
customer_reviews.text: It might be fine for a background low volume low output bookshelf speakers, but there is so much noise passthrough its unusable on any decent setup. Its picking up the noise from the motor of my Realstic LAB 2100 and from the movement of the tone arm, horrible. I have used the realistic on a vintage AVS5700s pioneer that has a built in phono preamp and its quiet as a church mouse. This is unplayable and unsuable for any serious HIFI work. This box is nothing better than a paperweight that you CANT RETURN! Which is outrageous. I should have known better, there is a reason its so cheap..
customer_reviews.author: Spaxspore

customer_reviews.title: Good Price; Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I am totally satisfied with the Pyle-Pro P444 preamp. The price is very reasonable and my application was too bost the input going into my receiver from a turntable. If you can't get volume this is what is needed. A cheep way to overcome the modern amps that don't have a "phono in". Phono in runs the signal thru an internal amp. If your coming in thru "aux" or another input you need a preamp to take the place of it. This gem does it flawlessly. Good buy, good product.
customer_reviews.author: John Spears

customer_reviews.title: Cannot be compared with the actual Phone inputs on the amplifier
customer_reviews.text: I Bought it to test my turntable to my new sony receiver which does not have phone inputs. Voice is super dull, yes it did serve the purpose to connect the turntable but the output is of very very low quality. Actual phone inputs on my old receiver is the best. Absolutely a bad product for usage. I just disconnected with in 5 min of listen to vinyl. I did not return it bcos, I don't want to fall in the category of not having the phone pre-amp. I am keeping it to say, OK I have it. But cannot listen to the music.. worst quality of sound output.
customer_reviews.author: pv2122

customer_reviews.title: Great Price, Great Outcome.
customer_reviews.text: The last item to make the turntable I found in the bottom of a goodwill bin come to life. This preamp boosted the audio signal from my turntable to my speakers. Everything sounds crisp as I type this review. The build quality is aluminum so I do not expect it to break anytime soon without some force. Overall a great product at a reasonable price. If you are curious the turntable I am using is a Philips hi-fi electronic 222.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Good little preamp
customer_reviews.text: Great little pre-amp. I have a small living room set and don’t want a bulky audio setup. This pre-amp gives enough juice to the signal coming out of my turntable and pumps it to my sound bar which and it fills out the living nicely. I wish it had a power off switch instead of me using a surge protector or unplugging the power cord from the wall. Great price and good built quality.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel

customer_reviews.title: Great little phono connector/turntable headphone amp
customer_reviews.text: Tiny size makes it useable for any installation. clear sound when matched with my Kinter mini amp/speakers, etc. 1/4 inch audio out female jack makes it suitable as a turntable direct to headphone amp but you cannot control the volume so headphones with built-in volume control would be helpful. Also note, no power switch.
customer_reviews.author: SJS Dallas

customer_reviews.title: EASY to Order, EASY to Install
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to boot the volume on my old photograph and Amazon this product made it so easy. I recv'd it quickly. It required no instructions (but if you find you do need help, go to YouTube) Plug in the cables and WOW and can actually hear out from my phono graph top my new receiver and it sounds GREAT!!! And did i mention the price? In researching this, you could easily spend $50-100 or more... but get this one!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. C

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive pre-amp that works.
customer_reviews.text: A good and inexpensive way to get back into phono- listening again when your system lacks a pre-amp. My old Techniques turntable needed to have a ground added to get rid of that nasty 60 cycle hum. But after I added a few hard-wired connections, ...and then connected that wire to the unit's ground, it worked great!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for your buck, compact, built well and looks nice.
customer_reviews.text: It does what a basic phono preamp does. The audio is clear and at the right level. It's compact and doesn't look out of place with my Hi-Fi setup. The best part is the price, I reckon you would have to spend $50 for something that's a little better, like an ART preamp. Does need anti slip pads on the bottom, but I just stuck some on and it's fine. Also wish it had a volume knob and on/off switch, but for this price you won't find those and get a decent sound. With this you get good sound so I can live without other perks.
customer_reviews.author: Zach's Games

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This Pre-amp works great! It is exactly what I was looking for! Great price and functionality! Nice job Pyle! Shipping was spot on as well! I would definitely recommend this product! FYI, I needed it for a Phonograph player to boost the signal to an amplifier I have. It also worked connected directly to my computer using the microphone input jack. Using the Windows Voice Recorder, am able to record my old albums with very good sound reproduction!
customer_reviews.author: Derek Gerry

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE,Works great. Excellent value.UPDATE.
customer_reviews.text: I'm been using it for about 30 minutes. Works great. I'll report back in a few months. Update July 23,2019. Two days in use for about 2 hours running time and is ok in general . Some times I'm getting a ground hum sound, very annoying. Also it doesn't have a switch to turn off, so you will have to unplug the power supply line.
customer_reviews.author: Coolpadrino

customer_reviews.title: Extremly Poor Manufacturing Quality Control
customer_reviews.text: This unit worked fine for about three hours -- I was initially very pleased. Then the left channel began to output excessive static/rumbling noise that increased from intermittent to eventually continuous. To troubleshoot I switched cables, tried plugging the unit into a different amplifier, and tried a different source. The left channel issue continued. When I tried to contact the manufacturer for help I was ignored (they even deleted the first trouble ticket I entered at their web site and have ignored the second). There clearly is a quality issue with the unit. Fortunately Amazon's return policy took care of Pyle's poor manufacturing quality control. Amazon had halted shipping this unit but I see it's available again. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: PJL

customer_reviews.title: pretty darn good
customer_reviews.text: Seems to do the job. I had a horrible buzz until i hooked a ground wire from it to the player(it has a lug to connect to). Since then no issues. Works great. I'm an audiophile and its a 9. Not entirely perfect, there is a tiny little bit of noise if you turn your amp way up. It should have a power button but that would have cost $.10 more to put in. Still a 5 star considering the price. No complaints
customer_reviews.author: I am a GeekTop Contributor: BBQ Styles

customer_reviews.title: Good place to start
customer_reviews.text: It brought my 1976 audio-technical back to life! However, there is no volume control. I’d imagine there is better sound quality to be had with a more expensive pre-amp. But I bought this not knowing if the turntable would work so didn’t want to waste a lot of money On a pre-amp. Will likely upgrade to a more expensive pre-amp at some Point.
customer_reviews.author: Biconclavicator

customer_reviews.title: Good for your old turntables!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this preamp on a very regular basis for almost five years now and i'm completely happy with it. The sound quality is great, maybe not audiophile quality but at this price point you can't beat it. Another bonus is the outputs work simultaneously, so you can feed out to two different receivers if for some reason you might want to do that. Nice to breath new life into an old turntable!
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed to connect my Vizio soundbar to my record player! Extremely easy to hook up with all the right fittings for me. What a relief that I didn't need to spend a lot of money 2 use my original phonograph player. I saw a YouTube video and the fellow was using this exact model 2 play his records again!
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Only good things to say
customer_reviews.text: This is a magic box! This is an attractive little unit...not that it matters since it's connected behind the stereo, anyway. If you need to boost your turntable's signal so it's comparable with your other components, I highly recommend this. The installation took only about five minutes. At a price of $20 (including shipping), you simply can't go wrong. Any additional noise is the result of amplifying the snap, crackle, and pop of your vinyl records. I can't detect any hiss or hum from the unit, itself.
customer_reviews.author: Eric A. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Fixed my quiet, grainy turntable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I inherited a vintage turntable that had no amplification. I bought speakers and a receiver that had an integrated amp, but the sound quality was still terrible (grainy, hollow and quiet, even at max receiver volume). I didn't know what was up (I'm in no way an audiophile), but I went out on a limb and bought a little pre-amp to see if that made a difference. Lo and behold, this thing worked like a miracle. Great sound quality, great price, and now I can listen to records like a real hipster. Woohoo!
customer_reviews.author: ITCampbell

customer_reviews.title: It's sounds good despite the affordable price
customer_reviews.text: I held off buying a phono preamp for a long time, even after I had the space again to set up a turntable, mainly assuming I'd have to pay a lot for another piece of gear in lieu of an old DJ mixer that was falling apart (and bulky for just listening). This comes along, and it's quality. Problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: nice litte preamplifies
customer_reviews.text: My vintage amplifier had the phono input suddently not working anymore. Got this little preamp and plugged it into the tuner input, and it worked as well as the original. The only problem is the little power supply that is for 110 V, and in France we have 220 V, so I had to use a replacement transformer and it worked ok. There is very little noise (comparable to the other preamps I had in the past).
customer_reviews.author: valve heater

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: This is the first preamp I have used. I have always used older receivers with phono inputs. I just bought a newer (used) receiver and it had no phono input. Plugged in the PP444 and beautiful music came out of the speakers. Thank you. I'm not sure what a really expensive preamp would provide that this inexpensive one can't.
customer_reviews.author: Jared R Towler

customer_reviews.title: Good sounding phono turntable preamplifier
customer_reviews.text: The Pyle PP444 is a very compact turntable preamp that has made it possible for me to connect my turntable, outfitted with a magnetic cartridge, to my amplifier which doesn't have an input for a turntable. I haven't played my vinyl records for over a decade until now. It's amazing how good these records sound when played using this Pyle preamp into a good amplifier and speaker system.
customer_reviews.author: StewartJay

customer_reviews.title: Very affordable, works great.
customer_reviews.text: This preamp works great. Got my old turntable working through my Denon AVR. It did not have phono inputs and I didn't know I needed a preamp to make it work. Did some research and got educated and found this very affordable preamp. It works great! No hum, no buzz. Enjoying my old vinyl again.
customer_reviews.author: Mike R.

customer_reviews.title: but it sounded like toy. I have a Musical Fidelity amp and ...
customer_reviews.text: Well, I connected the preamp to my Dual phono turntable (MM) and also connected it to my Mac mini. I don't know if it's due to DAC of the Mac mini or this amp, but it sounded like toy. I have a Musical Fidelity amp and classical music fan. Yes, I'm an audiophile. When the Dual turn table is connected to the Musical Fidelity amp, it sounds great. But the recorded one through Mac mini DAC was not. OK for pop music lovers. I am still not sure if it's due to the DAC or this amp.
customer_reviews.author: Jong Am Park

customer_reviews.title: Works well, I’d buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Until turntable is powered on I notice a little hum to audio. If your asking yourself did He hook up the ground wire, yes I did. Over all happy with the sound. No on/off switch but that’s no biggie, just use a power strip and shut off there. I’d buy it again for a low end set up!
customer_reviews.author: Michael W. Noland

customer_reviews.title: Great product for a good price.
customer_reviews.text: I was given a hand me down turntable That needed a little TLC. After I got it working, I found out my “modern-day” receiver did not have a photo input. This little pre-amp was inexpensive and compact. Took just a couple of minutes to plug everything up. I dug out an old LP, plunked it on the platter, and was AMAZED at the sound. This really helped to make a great addition to my entertainment center.
customer_reviews.author: David E.

customer_reviews.title: Says what it does, Does what it says
customer_reviews.text: nothing fancy (that's not a bad thing) it does what it says, it lets you use your record player (that doesn't have built in pre-amp) with just about any Amp/Receiver. It also doesn't have a hefty price tag like some alternatives. sound quality is great to my non-snobby ears. My vintage Sony PS-T33 sounds great through this and my slim receiver i have tucked away in our family room. The size is perfect to tuck away. now I get to have just my turntable and a handful or records out on our cabinet for display and play, and all the background equipment safely stashed away.
customer_reviews.author: TimmyJ

customer_reviews.title: Works fine at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I know very little about electronics. I have a vintage tuner and wanted to connect a very old Bang and Olafson turntable. The combination produced a very low audio output. I thought maybe the signal from the turntable was too low. I connected this preamp, and now have great sound. Price of the preamp was very reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Crystal Clear.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this RIAA preamp to use with my vintage Garrard Lab70 turntable hooked up to home brewed vintage amplifier with Bose 901's. From the 70's. My old L.P. Collection sounds great. And no turntable rumbles or hum.. Great fidelity...it nice to enjoy listening to my LP's . For 15 bucks for this preamp, it did the job for me. Thank you Pyle .. 👍
customer_reviews.author: Ronald G. Villata

customer_reviews.title: gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: the pyle phono preamp is pretty good. gets the job done. would be nice to have a volume control but that isn’t essential. has good build quality. can’t tell a difference in sound quality from the internal amp in my record player and the unit itself, which is a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: Ian W.

customer_reviews.title: Allows turntable use on non-phono input receivers
customer_reviews.text: This device worked perfectly. I recently replaced my receiver and didn't even think to check that it had phono inputs (it didn't). I was so used to not having to worry about it over the years that I forgot you need a pre-amp for receivers without phono input jacks.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Annoying occasional hum
customer_reviews.text: Does it work? Technically, yes. Although there is a bit of weirdness when you attach the ground wire, it tends to buzz and hum if you don’t have it placed exactly right. We use it, it works but the hum returns occasionally and I have to adjust the wire again.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.Gal

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: We use these all the time at work and they seem to hold up well. Simple yet robust. Great product for the price, the overall construction seems to be very good using a metal case instead of cheap plastic. Audio quality is really good as well. This comes with all the connectors and power supply to simply plug and play your vinyl right out of the box. Grab one and enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: A good value. Accurate enough for critical work.
customer_reviews.text: Quite a nice little preamp. The RIAA curve seems reasonably accurate, it's quiet, and although its output is unbalanced, with proper grounding it's quite clean. I've listened to it alongside my more expensive Rek-O-Kut preamp and it stands up quite well.
customer_reviews.author: Kennith Scott Johnson

customer_reviews.title: The hum produced by this unit is louder that the record being played!!
customer_reviews.text: I should have read the other reviews of this product before purchasing. This unit produces a very loud 'hum' when in use. My Akai turntable is grounded as well as my Denon amp but still this preamp hums even after grounding . I returned it for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Terry S.

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: I did not realize that I needed a pre-amp to use a turntable with my powered speakers. Pyle (Thru Amazon) and $20 later I was up and running. If you buy these speakers, plug the Pyle pre-amp into the PC inputs. Don't try to use a spliter and have a CD player and turntable share the AUX input.
customer_reviews.author: Jerome Jurewicz

customer_reviews.title: Use that old turntable with new receivers that have no phono pre-amps.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived as promised (Prime) and immediately hooked it up. My Audio Technica turntable did not have any output (though it is supposed to have an onboard pre-amp) so i wasn't getting any sound. After installing the Pyle Pro PPP my turntable magically started playing. Now I can enjoy my system at full blast. Sounds great, no hum that some reviewers noted. Only issue is no power button. Not sure why but for the price I'll leave it on and we'll see how long it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Kmclean

customer_reviews.title: Functional preamp that looks "industrial" at a good price!
customer_reviews.text: Functional, small preamp for older turntables with magnetic cartridges. Audiophiles know there are great reasons not to give these up and keep them functioning--and this will help you do so. Has a convenient grounding point as most such phonographs already had a ground wire. I'm using it with a new Pyle amplifier which doesn't need the preamp, but increases the versatility of the setup. I like the "made in my workshop" look.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Victor S. Alpher

customer_reviews.title: Rad Preamp
customer_reviews.text: This is the first preamp I've ever owned and certainly the first I've ever hooked up. Nevertheless I knew enough to hook it up to my stereo without consulting the documentation - it's that easy (so long as you know what an rca cable is...and you'll probably recognize it instantly even if you don't). I'm sure that you can spend as much as you please on this piece of equipment, but Pyle has you covered for a scant $15 - $20. Just buy this one. It's rad
customer_reviews.author: The Chan Chan Man

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Good Preamp When You Consider The Price
customer_reviews.text: Honestly for what I use it for, it's performing way beyond my expectations. I have a vintage Garrard record changer with a Shure cartridge that I connect to my computer's sound card. I was using a L.K.G. preamp before this one it it always sounded flat to me. This Pyle really makes the music sound present and clear. I haven't had it long enough to see if it has any of the issues the other reviewers had but if it does I will update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Willhill

customer_reviews.title: Perfect basic pre-amp at the perfect price.
customer_reviews.text: Using this pre-amp to interface my new Fluance RT-82 turntable with a 100w Pioneer receiver which has no Phono input. Though lacking its own controls, all I really needed was for it to bring the signal up to line level, which it does flawlessly so far. The only thing you need to make sure of is that you have your turntable properly grounded to the pre-amp and the pre-amp properly grounded to the receiver or else you'll likely experience a humming noise. In summary, this little pre-amp does the trick perfectly and can't be beat for the price.
customer_reviews.author: AmFam

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for and it Worked Perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: Basically, I had an old turntable and a bunch of old records that I wanted to try using once again. And this low cost Pyle Preamp was exactly what I needed to get the job done. A super simply unit, that is easy to install, and to my vintage ears, the volume level and sound quality both seem perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Cinquini

customer_reviews.title: Nice little vinyl volume booster
customer_reviews.text: A lot of varying reviews on this, but good experience so far. I can actually hear my vinyl now, it boosts the signal pretty well for a 13 dollar item. And the build quality seems pretty decent, it's a heavier piece of machinery than expected. It's annoying that stereo receiver manufacturers thought that nobody would want to play vinyl on their stereos anymore, creating the need for this type of item. Who would be buying a stereo if not some vinyl owners? And now vinyl has the last laugh, and as had a resurgence in the last few years.
customer_reviews.author: Ross J. Raniere

customer_reviews.title: This thing is amazing
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. I have purchased one for my Wurlitzer Jukebox and another for my Technics turntable. Both produce a crisp and pure solid-state tone. A phono preamp is not a complicated thing, so I see no reason to ever get anything beyond this, unless you want to spend inordinate amounts of money for a pricey tube preamp. This thing is very very highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: bispymusic

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with exchanged unit
customer_reviews.text: First unit had very loud 60 cycle hum w/o a pickup attached. Was defective. Exchanged it and replacement is what is intended. I am using it as a line amplifier for not a phono turntable. Very happy with exchanged unit.
customer_reviews.author: Mary C. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Works well, not the best sound quality.
customer_reviews.text: Hard to complain for the price. Simple and effective preamp. Sound quality is not spectacular, but to get better sound you would have to pay 4x the price. Sound quality is quite acceptable for casual listening of LPs
customer_reviews.author: Long Beach Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great price, works great.
customer_reviews.text: We have a lot of old vinyl records. Our JVC turntable output was designed for an older receiver which still had a "Phono" input. When plugged into a newer receiver, volume would have to be on max to hear anything and had no bass. This little $12.99 preamp completely solved that problem. Just connect the cables and go. Sound quality is as good as it was with the old receiver with special phonograph input. The preamp is small enough to hide in the component rack. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: ER

customer_reviews.title: Well come to find out all I needed was better phono cable with build in ground on both ends
customer_reviews.text: I bought it and thought it would fix the hum. It did not it actually amplified it. Why 5 stars you ask. Well come to find out all I needed was better phono cable with build in ground on both ends. This resolved the issue. SO if you are getting a hum more than likely you have a crappy cable.
customer_reviews.author: PiO

customer_reviews.title: Works great, doesn't introduce noise
customer_reviews.text: Totally transparent function, mating a vintage Dual 604 turntable with modern Audio Technica cartridge into a new Onkyo receiver. Works great, no detectable background noise, Frequency response sounds full. Nice attractive appearance.
customer_reviews.author: J. Beyda

customer_reviews.title: Good, compact and easy set-up.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound quality when properly set up. I initially forgot to check the ground wire... Compact, well built and very affordable. I haven't had a turntable for years, and it is good to be back in the spinning world of music.
customer_reviews.author: Alok Jolly

customer_reviews.title: Works well for older phonograph connection to newer system
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this product hoping it would work as indicated and was quite happy it did. I can recommend this to any needing to attache a phonograph player to a newer system.Only issue is phonograph record plays in mono not stereo
customer_reviews.author: Michael Abrams

customer_reviews.title: Great way to bring back your vinyl!
customer_reviews.text: I work in a local recording studio and occasionally someone would bring in an old album to be converted to CD. We had an old home stereo unit with a turntable on top, but it went out. We had a belt-drive turntable, but I needed a phono preamp to get it to work on our recording equipment since the turntable was a stand-alone without one. The PYLE-PRO PP444 was the perfect solution. It hooked into the equipment effortlessly and performed perfectly. Be sure you ground the unit to the turntable as per set-up instructions. Really a great-working piece of interfacing equipment at the right price.
customer_reviews.author: Kennon W. Daus

customer_reviews.title: Terrible sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I made the mistake of assuming because the this item was designated :Amazon's Choice" that the sound quality would be reasoably good. That was not the case. Sound was very thin with almost zero bass response and very thin midrange response. Was using decent turntable with AT95e cartridge. Stay clear if you are looking for accurate sound reproduction. Note also that the item is not returnable.
customer_reviews.author: MPBundy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent addition to my audio station for little cost and time
customer_reviews.text: I recently decided to go ahead and perform surgery on my AT LP120 turntable by taking out the internal preamp and getting this as a replacement. I'm honestly shocked at the sound difference. This is a no fuss, easy to connect little box that gives my set up the boost in sound it needed. Now I have warmer, clearer music with a $12 purchase. The AC adapter it comes with has a bit of a short cable, but it's not a big deal. Those are easy to replace.
customer_reviews.author: Turtlesloth

customer_reviews.title: Product Exactly What I Needed - Works Great, Great Price - Thank you!
customer_reviews.text: The Pyle Phone Turntable Preamp got here quick and was easy to connect and make my old turntable sound like new again. Certainly and inexpensive way to listen to my old vinyl and love. Thank you! Happy Customer
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Hummin' along
customer_reviews.text: I still get a deep unsettling hum in my equipment and turntable, i like the concept but just didnt work out well for me. i would like to receive some advice if in the event I can get rid of the hum that is when i use it.
customer_reviews.author: c. singleton

customer_reviews.title: PYLE PP444 Ultra Compact Phono Turntable Pre-Amplifier is small and powerful!
customer_reviews.text: The PYLE PP444 Ultra Compact Phono Turntable Pre-Amplifier does exactly what it's supposed to do, in providing the amplification needed from the record player to the stereo. Ultra compact it sure is, neatly tucked away behind the tape deck to which it's power supply is connected. Design is simple and sturdy, with just the basic connectors necessary for it to do its job. Price is doable, especially in a pinch, as the unit has already assisted in bringing the old records back to life.
customer_reviews.author: WildDog

customer_reviews.title: Problem solved!
customer_reviews.text: I refurbished a 1970s console stereo. The output levels from my tablet, echo dot and mp3 player wasn't high enough so I had to turn the volume control up to 90 percent to hear the music from these devices. This product has sufficient gain so that the volume is sufficient with the control at 30 percent. And the music is clear and undistorted. I am satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: James Siewert

customer_reviews.title: Small and inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: Decided to hook up my old turntable to a receiver finding it did not have a phono option. Purchased the Pyle PP444 and was up and running in minutes. Nice metal box and small size makes it easy to tuck away. Works well for me.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Palmer

customer_reviews.title: It work
customer_reviews.text: After some trial and errors. It worked. The output is ok, not of high quality but for the money it is good.
customer_reviews.author: vincent

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly, no hum, fantastic sound!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a multi-use amplifier to use with DVD player, smart tv, etc, but wanted to use my turntable and could not. Just searched on Bing, and this great product came up. Purchased on Amazon, arrived in three days, just works perfectly. Many thanks, as I prize my vinyl collection.
customer_reviews.author: wyngate1

customer_reviews.title: It works with 30+ year old Technics turntable and Pioneer AV 5/1 recvr
customer_reviews.text: Needed a phono preamp to connect my 30+year old Technics turntable pulled out of the garage (I cleaned and repaired an RCA jack) to see if I could listen to all these vinyls I have. Pleasantly surprised to be able to again listen to music with instrument separation, depth and clarity on vinyl.
customer_reviews.author: Viletti

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a stereo receiver that was dying and I could not be happier with it. Did have an issue with the ground but was fixable and now it’s awesome. Great item for a vinyl person on the cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Jason A Greenhalgh

customer_reviews.title: An okay product, not great!
customer_reviews.text: I added this to my Denon receiver so I could connect my turntable to my system. While it does the job the sound quality coming through from my record albums is not that great. Lack of dynamics, very flat.
customer_reviews.author: Ben B

customer_reviews.title: Probably ok if it worked but who knows. I wonlt be buying another one to try!
customer_reviews.text: Waited a while before I opened and attempted to use it. When I did it only worked for a short period of time before overheating and putting out no sound. When I attempted to have the company honor the warranty I was told they would attempt to repair under warranty only if I paid for shipping (expected) and prepaid for the return shipping which in total was way more than just purchasing a new one. Disappointed with the quality and service from Pyle.
customer_reviews.author: TIMSIT

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Product works just as expected. Reasonably priced, fast shipping, and just overall great preamp for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: T Saunders

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: I used this turntable preamp to increase the volume for converting the analog sound to digital mp3 in my music digitizer. It does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Review

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, and Exactly What I Needed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a Sony direct drive turntable I recently purchased. So far I am very satisfied! The build quality of this little guy is very good, and the connectors seem to be quite durable. The sound quality is crisp and I didn't hear any hiss or degradation of the sound quality due to the preamp. The only thing I wish it had were little rubber feet so it would stay put if wires get tugged. I'll probably add them myself, but it would be nice to see Pyle add this to the product on the next model. Overall, very satisfied, and for the price, count me impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Boushell

customer_reviews.title: Best for your money!
customer_reviews.text: Just connected to my Harmon/Kardon AVR 247 receiver. So happy!!! I've not enjoyed my vinyl for many years... listening to one of the greatest albums, sound wise of all times, Steely Dan's Aja. It's bringing tears to my eyes. Thanks Pyle for such a great affordable product.
customer_reviews.author: JAF

customer_reviews.title: Good price, works well
customer_reviews.text: This preamp with terminal for my phonograph ground wire was just what I needed. I connected its two rca outputs to a male 3.5mm trrs, to use through bookshelf mini system. The ground silenced the 60-cycle AC hum, and preamp did its job.
customer_reviews.author: TimP

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it, buy a different brand!
customer_reviews.text: The Pyle-Pro PP444 works but seems to introduce too much noise (a low hum and the reception of a local radio station) into the system. I bought new pair of shorter RCA type cables (1-foot) with better shielding and also cut length of the turntable's ground wire to about 1-foot as well but the noise remained. It was so cheap it's not worth sending back, so it will just sit in a box until I can give it away...sorry PYLE.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: WORKS GREAT!!! I LOVE IT!!!
customer_reviews.text: This phono preamp works perfectly and sounds great if you connect the ground wire for your turntable properly. The people who say it makes a humming sound obviously don't know how to hook it up...
customer_reviews.author: anonymous D

customer_reviews.title: Great Value.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great value, I was looking for a way to hook up my turntable with a magnetic cartridge to my 1970 GE console stereo. This is the perfect solution. Without this preamp the volume would be too low. Priced much lower than other brands, but performs like it's high end.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Ferraro

customer_reviews.title: Meh...you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to check the operation of a used turn table. I went from barely hearing anything non-amped, to sort of hearing Pink Floyd with the volume turned all the way up. You get what you pay for. Good to know my turn table works though! No to spend some decent cash and buy a better preamp. No volume control Buzzing from power supply Made well. It is a Pyle unit, not a name paired with quality in any stretch of the imagination.
customer_reviews.author: MotoSean

customer_reviews.title: good price, easy install, good quality
customer_reviews.text: The first preamp delivered had a ground screw that wouldn't tighten. The return was easy to do and I had a new here in two days. That one was easy to install and is good quality material. I would not hesitate to deal with Pyle again.
customer_reviews.author: Grancy

product_meta.title: Pyle Phono Turntable Preamp - Mini Electronic Audio Stereo Phonograph Preamplifier with RCA Input, RCA Output & Low Noise Operation Powered by 12 Volt DC Adapter (PP444)
product_meta.description:
This electronic preamplifier stands up to the test and will provide you with serious sound performance. The PP444 is perfect for bringing your studio equipment's phono-level output to a more suitable line-level output. It'll take your audio signal, amplify its strength and prepare it for further processing by your receiver or amplifier. Preamps technically provide voltage gain to your desired equipment and are key to assisting the signal source, whether it's a turntable, musical instrument or microphone. The ultra-low noise audio conditioning circuitry allows the preamp to boost audio to levels that are more manageable for various types of audio equipment. You'll find it easier to adjust the recording level volumes of different sources from microphones and instruments alike. You should position your preamp close to the source to reduce unwanted noise and interference. Preamps can sometimes come built into the stereo equipment, but if that's not the case, the PP444 is an easy install, wise choice and great addition to any musician or producer. Take your sounds and audio production skills to the next level with the PP444 Preamplifier. Features: Converts Phono Signals to Line Level Signals State-of-the-Art Circuitry Accommodates Magnetic Pickups Ultra-Low Noise Operation Improves Sound Performance Connects to Turntables and Other Studio Equipment Input Sensitivity: 3mV at 50K Ohms (Phono) Dedicated RCA and 1/4" Output Connectors Output: 2V max (P-P) at 10K Ohms DC 12-Volt Power Adapter Included Frequency Response: 20 Hz ~ 20 KHz ±2dB S/N Ratio (A-WTD): 70 dB - Output Level: 2V THD: 0.08% @ 1KHz and 3mV Input | S/N Ratio: 70dB Input Sensitivity/Impedance/Phono 3 mV/50K Ohms Load Impedance: 10K Ohms - Reference Voltage: 1V d Dimensions (W x H x D): 3.54" x 2.13" x 1.02" Sold as: Unit Weight: 0.85 lbs.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


& PP444 PP555 PP999 PHE300 PHE400 Turntable / Phono Pre-Amplifiers Noise / Hum Eliminators Jacks RCA & 1/4'' RCA & 1/4'' RCA 1/4'' TRS 1/4'' TRS & XLR 12V DC Adaptor ✔ ✔ ✔
feature_bullets: CONVERTS PHONO SIGNALS: A turntable preamp that converts phono signals to Line Level Signals This state-of-the-art circuitry phono preamp can accommodate magnetic pickups with an input sensitivity of 3mV at 50K Ohms

LOW NOISE OPERATION: Offers outstanding performance with it’s Low-Noise Audio Operational Amplifiers The output is 2V max (P-P) at 10K Ohms It’s better to position the preamp close to the source to reduce unwanted noise and interference

CONNECTS TO TURNTABLES: Connect any turntable to modern sound equipment without specialized phono input for amplifying music For the receiver, this can be connected to speakers, computers, laptops and more
SIMPLE PLUG & PLAY: This mini preamp has stereo RCA inputs and stereo RCA outputs Connect the turntable to the RCA inputs and ground Then, connect the amplifier receiver to the RCA outputs
1 YEAR WARRANTY: We guarantee this electric phono preamplifier with both a 30 day no hassle money back return policy and a 1 year manufacturer’s guarantee
